citations.narrative:
The bottom left corner of a metal panel on the door frame of the turkey vulture enclosure was missing a screw and loose.
The turkey vulture was able to push the metal panel off the door while sticking its head through the frame. If a bird is able
to escape or stick certain parts of their body outside the enclosure, they can become lost, injured, or attacked by other
animals. Correct by ensuring primary enclosures are kept in good repair and maintained so they contain the birds
securely. Corrected during the inspection.

citations.desc: Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control.
citations.narrative:
The facility has an ineffective pest control program that is not sufficient to control the pest population. In the indoor portion
of the facility there were multiple areas where rodent feces had accumulated including along the floor, on storage
shelving, and in empty food bowls within the enclosures. Additionally, several flies were seen flying and landing in the
food bowl of a Scarlet Macaw enclosure housed outside. Pests can post a hazard to the health and wellbeing of the birds
by either injuring them, or exposing them to potential diseases and illness. Correct by 8 July 2025 by establishing and
maintaining a safe and effective program for the control of insects, ectoparasites, and avian and mammalian pests to
promote the health and wellbeing of the birds and to reduce contamination by pests in animal areas.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
n

narrative:
3.153(a)(1)(iii) 
   
Primary enclosures. 
The bottom left corner of a metal panel on the door frame of the turkey vulture enclosure was missing a screw and loose. 
The turkey vulture was able to push the metal panel off the door while sticking its head through the frame. If a bird is able 
to escape or stick certain parts of their body outside the enclosure, they can become lost, injured, or attacked by other 
animals. Correct by ensuring primary enclosures are kept in good repair and maintained so they contain the birds 
securely. Corrected during the inspection. 
3.158(d) 
   
Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control. 
The facility has an ineffective pest control program that is not sufficient to control the pest population. In the indoor portion 
of the facility there were multiple areas where rodent feces had accumulated including along the floor, on storage 
shelving, and in empty food bowls within the enclosures. Additionally, several flies were seen flying and landing in the 
food bowl of a Scarlet Macaw enclosure housed outside. Pests can post a hazard to the health and wellbeing of the birds 
by either injuring them, or exposing them to potential diseases and illness. Correct by 8 July 2025 by establishing and 
maintaining a safe and effective program for the control of insects, ectoparasites, and avian and mammalian pests to 
promote the health and wellbeing of the birds and to reduce contamination by pests in animal areas. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative. 
 
 n

species.scientific: Ara, Anodorhynchus, Primolius, Diopsittaca spp hybrid

species.common: CONGO AFRICAN GREY PARROT / GRAY PARROT
